00030 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00031 // Handler for the VBus state change interrupt
00032 // This method calls the CUsbDriver::Attach function to perform the necessary
00033 // operations.
00034 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00035 
00036 void ISR_VBus(void)
00037 {
00038     sSer.Attach ();
00039 
00040     // Acknowledge the interrupt
00041     //
00042     AT91F_PIO_GetInterruptStatus( AT91C_PIO_VBUS );
00043     AT91F_AIC_AcknowledgeIt( AT91C_BASE_AIC );
00044     }

00050 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00051 // Event sink implementation for the sSer CCDC instance.
00052 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00053 class CCallbacks: public CEventSink
00054 {
00055     CUsbDriver* pDriver;
00056 
00057     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00058     // \brief Initialization callback function
00059     // This callback is invoked whenever the USB API is initialized using the
00060     // USB_Init function. It should perform the following operations:
00061     //  -  If an OS is being used, install the USB driver
00062     //  -  Configure the USB controller interrupt
00063     //  -  Configure the VBus monitoring interrupt
00064     // Attention: Implementation of this callback is mandatory
00065     // \see CUsbDriver::Init
00066     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00067     void OnInit( void );
00068 
00069     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00070     // \brief Reset callback function
00071     // Invoked whenever the device is reset by the host. This function should
00072     // perform initialization or re-initialization of the user application.
00073     // Attention: Implementation of this callback is optional
00074     // \see CUsbDriver::EventHandler
00075     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00076     void OnReset( void );
00077 
00078     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00079     // \brief Suspend callback function
00080     // Invoked when the device is suspended by the host or detached from the bus.
00081     // If the device must enter low-power mode when suspended, then the necessary
00082     // code must be implemented here.
00083     // \see CUsbDriver::Attach
00084     // \see CUsbDriver::EventHandler
00085     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00086     void OnSuspend( void );
00087     
00088     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00089     // \brief Resume callback function
00090     // Invoked when the device is resumed by the host or attached to the bus. If
00091     // the suspend callback has put the device into low-power mode, then this
00092     // function must perform the necessary actions to return it to a normal mode of
00093     // operation.
00094     // \see CEventSink::OnSuspend
00095     // \see CUsbDriver::Attach
00096     // \see CUsbDriver::Handler
00097     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00098     void OnResume( void );
00099 
00100     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00101     // \brief New Request callback function
00102     // Invoked when a new SETUP request is received. The request can then be
00103     // retrieved by using the USB_GetSetup function on the CUsbObject instance.
00104     // \see EventHandler
00105     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00106     void OnNewRequest( void );
00107 
00108     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00109     // \brief  Interrupt SOF callback function
00110     //         Invoked when a SOF interrupt is received.
00111     // \see    CUsbDriver::EventHandler
00112     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00113     void OnStartOfFrame( void );
00114     
00115 public:
00116     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00117     // \brief  Constructor. Just reports initialization.
00118     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00119     CCallbacks( CUsbDriver* pArgDriver )
00120     {
00121         pDriver = pArgDriver;
00122 
00123         TRACE_INFO( "CCallback %08x, Driver=%08x\n", uint( this ), pDriver );
00124     }        
00125 };
00126 
00127 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00128 // Callback invoked during the initialization of the USB driver
00129 // Configures and enables USB controller and VBus monitoring interrupts
00130 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00131 void CCallbacks::OnInit( void )
00132 {
00133     TRACE_DEBUG_M( "OnInit\n" );
00134     
00135     // Configure and enable the USB controller interrupt
00136     //
00137     AT91F_AIC_ConfigureIt
00138     (
00139         AT91C_BASE_AIC,
00140         pDriver->GetDriverID (),
00141         AT91C_AIC_PRIOR_LOWEST,
00142         0, //AT91C_AIC_SRCTYPE_INT_HIGH_LEVEL,
00143         ISR_Wrapper_USB
00144         );
00145 
00146     AT91F_AIC_EnableIt( AT91C_BASE_AIC, pDriver->GetDriverID () );
00147 
00148 #ifdef USB_SELF_POWERED
00149 
00150     // Configure and enable the Vbus detection interrupt
00151     AT91F_AIC_ConfigureIt
00152     (
00153         AT91C_BASE_AIC,
00154         AT91C_ID_VBUS,
00155         AT91C_AIC_PRIOR_LOWEST,
00156         0, //AT91C_AIC_SRCTYPE_INT_HIGH_LEVEL,
00157         ISR_Wrapper_VBus
00158         );
00159 
00160     AT91F_PIO_InterruptEnable( AT91C_PIO_VBUS, AT91C_VBUS );
00161     AT91F_AIC_EnableIt( AT91C_BASE_AIC, AT91C_ID_VBUS );
00162 #else
00163     // Power up the USB controller
00164     pDriver->Attach ();
00165 #endif
00166     }

00168 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00169 // Callback invoked when the device becomes suspended
00170 // Disables LEDs (if they are used) and then puts the device into
00171 // low-power mode. When traces are used, the device does not enter
00172 // low-power mode to avoid losing some outputs.
00173 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00174 void CCallbacks::OnSuspend( void )
00175 {
00176     TRACE_DEBUG_M( "OnSuspend\n" );
00177 
00178     // DEV_Suspend ();
00179     }
00180 
00181 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00182 // Callback invoked when the device leaves the suspended state
00183 // The device is first returned to a normal operating mode and LEDs are
00184 // re-enabled. When traces are used, the device does not enter
00185 // low-power mode to avoid losing some outputs.
00186 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00187 void CCallbacks::OnResume( void )
00188 {
00189     TRACE_DEBUG_M( "OnResume\n" );
00190     
00191     // DEV_Resume ();
00192     }
00193 
00194 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00195 // Callback invoked when a new SETUP request is received
00196 // The new request if forwarded to the standard request handler,
00197 // which performs the enumeration of the device.
00198 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00199 void CCallbacks::OnNewRequest( void )
00200 {
00201     sSer.RequestHandler ();
00202     }
00203

00205 // Callback invoked when a Reset request is received
00206 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00207 void CCallbacks::OnReset( void )
00208 {
00209     TRACE_DEBUG_M( "OnReset\n" );
00210 }

00213 // Callback invoked when a SOF is received
00214 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00215 void CCallbacks::OnStartOfFrame( void )
00216 {
00217     }

00219 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00220 // Class describing how to handle PullUp and VBus of the board.
00221 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00222 class CXpuBoard : public CBoard
00223 {
00224     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00225     // \brief   Indicates the state of the VBus power line associated with the
00226     //          specified interface.
00227     // \return  true if VBus is detected, false otherwise
00228     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00229     bool IsVBusConnected( void )
00230     {
00231 #ifdef USB_SELF_POWERED
00232         return ISSET( AT91F_PIO_GetInput( AT91C_PIO_VBUS ), AT91C_VBUS ); 
00233 #else
00234         return true;
00235 #endif
00236     }
00237 
00238     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00239     // \brief   Enables the external pull-up on D+ associated with the specified
00240     //          USB controller
00241     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00242     void ConnectPullUp( void )
00243     {
00244         AT91F_PIO_ClearOutput( AT91C_PIO_PULLUP, AT91C_PULLUP );
00245     }
00246 
00247     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00248     // \brief   Disables the external pull-up on D+ associated with the specified
00249     //          USB controller
00250     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00251     void DisconnectPullUp( void )
00252     {
00253         AT91F_PIO_SetOutput( AT91C_PIO_PULLUP, AT91C_PULLUP );
00254     }
00255 
00256     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00257     // \brief   Indicates the state of the external pull-up associated with the
00258     //          specified interface.
00259     // \return  true if the pull-up is currently connected, false otherwise.
00260     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00261     bool IsPullUpConnected( void )
00262     {
00263         return ISSET(AT91F_PIO_GetInput( AT91C_PIO_PULLUP ), AT91C_PULLUP ); 
00264     }
00265 
00266     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00267     // \brief   Configures the external pull-up on the D+ line associated with
00268     //          the specified USB controller.
00269     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00270     void ConfigurePullUp( void )
00271     {
00272         AT91F_PMC_EnablePeriphClock( AT91C_BASE_PMC, 1 << AT91C_ID_PULLUP );
00273         AT91F_PIO_SetOutput( AT91C_PIO_PULLUP, AT91C_PULLUP ); // disconnect
00274         AT91F_PIO_CfgOutput( AT91C_PIO_PULLUP, AT91C_PULLUP );
00275     }
00276     
00277     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00278     // \brief   Configures the VBus monitoring PIO associated with the specified
00279     //          USB controller.
00280     //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00281     void ConfigureVBus( void )
00282     {
00283 #ifdef USB_SELF_POWERED
00284         AT91F_PMC_EnablePeriphClock( AT91C_BASE_PMC, 1 << AT91C_ID_VBUS );
00285         AT91C_PIO_VBUS->PIO_PPUDR = AT91C_VBUS; // disable pullup
00286         AT91F_PIO_CfgInput( AT91C_PIO_VBUS, AT91C_VBUS );
00287 #endif
00288     }
00289 };
